[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Unvalidated next_epoch_state] Does decode_value() verify that EpochState in epoch-ending ledger infos contains valid validator set with proper voting power distribution, or can attackers inject malicious validator sets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Error swallowing] Does map_err(Into::into) properly propagate BCS deserialization errors, or can invalid data cause decode_value() to return Ok() with partially-initialized LedgerInfoWithSignatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Round number tampering] Can bcs::from_bytes() produce LedgerInfo with manipulated round numbers that break 3-chain commit rules and cause safety violations in AptosBFT consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Macro: define_schema!] [Column family isolation] Does LEDGER_INFO_CF_NAME provide proper isolation from other column families, or can key/value corruption in other schemas affect LedgerInfoSchema data integrity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Macro: define_schema!] [Type safety] Does the schema macro enforce that only u64 keys and LedgerInfoWithSignatures values are used, or can type confusion bugs allow storing wrong data types? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Macro: define_schema!] [Concurrent access] Does define_schema! generate thread-safe implementations, or can concurrent reads/writes to LedgerInfoSchema from multiple validator threads cause data races? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Iteration order attack] Can attackers exploit the big endian ordering by injecting epoch keys that sort incorrectly in RocksDB, causing get_epoch_ending_ledger_info_iter() to return epochs out of order and break state sync? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Seek operation manipulation] Does big endian encoding guarantee that iter.seek(&epoch) correctly finds the epoch, or can boundary conditions with u64::MAX cause seek to miss critical epoch-ending ledger infos? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Lexicographic sorting] Is big endian encoding immune to lexicographic sorting attacks where byte-level manipulation changes the logical ordering of epoch numbers in RocksDB? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Quorum certificate forging] Can an attacker with database write access inject forged LedgerInfoWithSignatures with invalid 2f+1 signatures that validators trust without re-verification, causing safety violations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Epoch boundary attack] Can attackers store conflicting epoch-ending ledger infos for the same epoch number, causing validators to disagree on validator set transitions and fork the chain? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Double signing evidence erasure] Can malicious validators delete their equivocating ledger infos from storage to hide double-signing evidence and avoid slashing penalties? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Validator set manipulation] Can epoch-ending ledger infos be modified post-storage to change next_epoch_state validator composition, allowing unauthorized validators to participate in consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Transaction accumulator tampering] Can attackers modify transaction_accumulator_hash in stored ledger infos to make validators accept invalid transaction proofs during state sync? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [State root manipulation] Can stored ledger infos have their commit_info.executed_state_id modified to point to non-existent or malicious state roots, causing validators to diverge? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Version monotonicity violation] Does the schema enforce that newer epochs have strictly increasing version numbers, or can attackers store epoch N+1 with version < epoch N and break version ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Partial write corruption] Can RocksDB write failures during put_ledger_info() leave partially-written BCS data that decode_value() misinterprets as valid ledger infos with corrupted fields? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Missing epoch data] If epoch N is deleted but epoch N+1 exists, can get_epoch_state(N+1) fail to find the previous epoch's next_epoch_state, breaking epoch reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Orphaned epoch entries] Can ledger infos be stored for epoch numbers that don't correspond to actual epoch-ending transactions, causing validators to believe epochs ended at wrong versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Iterator consistency] Does get_epoch_ending_ledger_info_iter() guarantee consistent snapshots, or can concurrent writes cause iterators to skip epochs or return duplicates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Checkpoint corruption] During create_checkpoint(), can ledger infos be copied in inconsistent states where keys are written but values are missing, breaking backup/restore? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Concurrent epoch writes] Can two validators simultaneously call put_ledger_info() for the same epoch during epoch transition, causing last-write-wins corruption of the epoch-ending ledger info? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Read-write race] If one thread reads via decode_value() while another writes via encode_value() to the same epoch key, can partial writes cause decoding to see invalid mixed state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Cache invalidation race] Does the ArcSwap<latest_ledger_info> cache in LedgerMetadataDb get updated atomically with RocksDB writes, or can readers see stale cached ledger infos after newer ones are committed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/ledger_info/mod.rs] [Schema: LedgerInfoSchema] [Iterator invalidation] Can RocksDB iterator over LedgerInfoSchema become invalid during iteration if concurrent deletes/truncations remove epochs, causing use-after-free or panics? (High)
